comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content:
This photograph must date to ~29th April 1915.  The Times has a piece on Haldane's report on the nature and cause of the injuries to soldiers which he had presented to the authorities two days before.  Having no other means of protecting soldiers from gas at the time an appeal went out to the women of the country to make gauze masks in the hope that they would give some protection.

So, b0b42, there was no supplier's firm to have a Baroness at that point only the desire of the women of Great Britain to do what they could for our troops.

As always I can't copy any of the article here as The Times is a subscription site.
